hypothesis_content.title: Macro Catalyst Divergence: Strong USD as a Crypto Bull Signal in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a sharp, catalyst-driven rally in the US Dollar Index (DXY > +0.8% in a session) that coincides with stable/rising BTC prices creates a powerful, counter-intuitive long signal for BTC over the next 3-5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a Neutral regime, crypto is often range-bound and searching for a directional catalyst. A strong, news-driven USD rally that *fails* to push crypto down demonstrates remarkable underlying strength and absorption of selling pressure. This divergence suggests crypto is decoupling as a risk asset and may be anticipating a different macro narrative (e.g., currency debasement), leading to imminent outperformance.
entry_conditions: DXY rallies >0.8% in a single 24-hour period on a clear macro catalyst (e.g., hawkish central bank, strong data).
BTC closes the same 24-hour period flat or positive (between -0.5% and +5%).
BTC daily RSI (14) remains below 70 (not overbought).
Enter on the next 4-hour candle open following the daily close that confirms condition 3.

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price reaches a 7% gain from entry.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price breaks below the low of the 'divergence day' candle.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: This divergence pattern is followed by BTC underperformance vs. the S&P 500 over the next week in the majority (>60%) of cases.
